The Time at which the Conqueror seizes the Theme.  'China 's 1997 takeover would push over 10 per cent of the population out of the colony'.
The reason why the Conqueror seized the Theme.  'Rome initially conquered lands in order to enrich itself.'
The tool used by the Conqueror to seize the Theme.  'The army will conquer the far-away lands with the most sophisticated weapons ever made.'
This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.
Frequency is the number of times the Conquering event occurs per some unit of time.

Invading.definition: The Invader enters a Land in an aggressive attempt to cripple or dominate its people and its government.  'In August 1990 ,Iraq was invading Kuwait , which led to the Gulf war .'  'Some towns in Russia were ravaged by barbarian invasions in the thirteenth century.'

arguments.definition: The political area that is being crippled by the Invader's entry.  'Henry II had made no attempt to invade France.'
An entity used by the Invader to assist in the invasion of the Land.
The army or other self-directed entity that is entering the Land in a hostile manner.  'Indeed , three months later Hitler invaded Austria.'

Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Invader that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
An intentional action performed by the Invader that accomplishes the assault.
This FE identifies the location where the Invader invades the Land.
This FE identifies the purpose for which an Invader attacks the Land.
A state of affairs that the Invader is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the Land.
This FE identifies the time when the Invader invades Land.

The starting-point of the motion of the Invader or projectiles of the Invader as they move toward the the Place that the Land is occupying in the attack.  In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
This FE is used for any Depictive phrase describing the state of the Invader or Land while the Invasion occurs.

This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily.
The Result of the invasion on the Land by the Invader.

This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.

Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Form: once, twice, Cardinal expression + /it times, /it lots/a lot
In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole and describes and describes the event more generally.
The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Invader travels.
How often the Invader invades the Land.
This FE indicates the subtype of invasion into the Land.
This FE describes how intense the invation of the Land is.
The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
For how long the Land is invaded by the Invader.

Contact_image_schema.definition: A Profiled_region occupies the space in contact with the Ground.

arguments.definition: A region of space in contact with a Ground.
An entity whose location is relatively well-known and which, thus, can serve as a land-mark to identify the Profiled_region.

Invasion_scenario.definition: An Invader enters a land in an attempt to dominate the Attacked and they either fail or succeed.

arguments.definition: The  Invader is the entity that overtakes the Attacked.
The Attacked is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the Invader.
This FE describes the intensity and extent of the invasion event.
The manner in which the Invader takes over the Attacked.
The action by which the conquering event is made possible through the efforts of the Invader.
The location where the Invader takes over the Attacked.
The Time at which the Invader seizes the Attacked.
The reason why the Invader seized the Attacked.
The tool used by the Invader to seize the Attacked.

Repel.definition: A Defender successfully repels the aggressive attempt of takeover by an Enemy.  'We repelled the invaders.'

arguments.definition: The  Enemy is the entity that fails to overtake the Defender.  'General Monk would repel Jacobite invaders.'
The Defender is the land, government, and its people that the Enemy fails to seize.  'General Winter repelled invaders from Napoleon to Hitler.'
This FE describes the intensity and extent of the repelling event.
The manner in which the Defender repels the Enemy.
The action by which the repelling event is made possible through the efforts of the Defender.
The location where the Defender repels the Enemy.
The Time when the Defender succeeds to repel the Enemy.
The reason why the Defender repels the Enemy.
The tool used by the Defender to repel the Enemy.
This FE refers to the Invasion_act perpetrated by the Enemy.  'Spain pledged to repel any Allied invasion.'
This FE describes the outcome of the repelling event.

Region_with_portal.definition: A Portal, Exterior, Surface, Boundary, and Interior are picked out relative to a Ground.

arguments.definition: A region of space located inside a Ground.
An entity whose location is relatively well-known and which, thus, can serve as a land-mark to identify the Interior, Surface, or Boundary.
The region located outside of, but in contact with, the Ground.
The region associated with the boundary of the Ground.
The region which is not located inside or in contact with the Ground.

Becoming_dry.definition: An Entity loses moisture with the outcome of being in a dry state.  'The slab dries very quickly.'

arguments.definition: The Entity is the thing that loses moisture and becomes dry.
The intensity with which the Entity becomes dry.
The way in which the Entity becomes dry.
The location where the Entity becomes dry.
When the Entity becomes dry.
The situation in which the Entity is becoming dry.

This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
This FE indicates that the visiting is a particular instance in a series of repeated visiting events.

Attending.definition: An Agent goes to an Event and is present in a relatively non-participatory way.  'The Angolan guerrillas will attend a September meeting in Zaire.'  'We just go to the movies when it rains.'  'His attendance at the funeral did not go unnoticed.'

arguments.definition: The  Agent is the person who chooses to make himself present at the Event.
The Event is the deliberate set of happenings given at a particular time and place.
The way in which the Agent went about going to the Event.
Through what strategies and efforts the Agent made possible his attendance at the Event.
The location where the Agent attends the Event.
When the Agent attends the Event.
Under what conditions the Agent goes to the Event.
The reason why the Agent goes to the Event.
This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end.
The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
This FE describes the event as a whole.

Abandonment.definition: An Agent leaves behind a Theme effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.   'Carolyn abandoned her car and jumped on a red double decker bus.'  'Perhaps he left the key in the ignition'  'Abandonment of a child is considered to be a serious crime in many jurisdictions.'  There are also metaphorically used examples:  'She left her old ways behind .'

arguments.definition: The Agent is the person who acts to leave behind the Theme.
The Theme is the entity that is relinguished to no one from the Agent's possession.
The location where the Agent gives up the Theme.
When the Agent gives up the Theme.
The style in which the Agent gives up the Theme.
For what expanse of time the Agent has given up the Theme.
Explanation denotes a proposition from which the act of abandonment logically follows.
The FE Depictive describes the Agent during the abandoning event.
The extent to which the Agent leaves the Theme behind.
An action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the action indicated by the target.
The purpose for which the Agent abandons the Theme.
A description of the event as a whole.

Soaking_up.definition: An Item becomes filled with a Substance as a result of movement of liquid into visible or invisible interstices in the Item.  'Paper and board absorb moisture in the winter.'  'A stable soil soaks up water.'

arguments.definition: The Item is the absorbant friendly thing that takes in the Substance.
The Substance is the material that is taken in by the Item.
The location where the Item takes in Substance.
When the Item takes in Substance.
For what length of time the Item is imbued with Substance.
The way in which the Item soaks in the Substance.
Degree describes the extent to which a particular absorption event deviates from the norm.

Cause_emotion.definition: An Agent acts to  cause a Experiencer to feel a certain emotion.  'I was so offended by her behaviour towards me.'  'It does not matter if the cartoon is insulting to men.'

arguments.definition: The Agent is the person who's action's cause an emotion in the Experiencer.
The Experiencer feels an emotion as caused by the Agent.  'You will perhaps be affronted by my frankness'
This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.  'I had mortally offended her.'
The tool used by the Agent to cause an emotion in the Experiencer.  'We will insult you with our compassion'
This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
An act performed by an Agent that enables them to act upon the Experiencer.</def-root >
In what way the Agent causes an emotion in the Experiencer.
This FE describes the event as a whole, often as a VPing.
Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.
This FE describes the reason for the state of affairs described by the target.
For how long instances of an Agent causing the Patient an emotion has repeatedly occured.
When the Agent causes emotion in the Experiencer.

This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
The Event is the occasion or happening that evokes emotions in the Experiencer. This Event occurs as the direct result of a sentient being's actions.
Type designates the kind of emotion that the Agent causes the Experiencer to have.
Medium is the physical or abstract setting in which the Agent causes the Experiencer to feel an emotion.
The location where the Agent causes the Experiencer to feel the emotion.

Emotions_by_stimulus.definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State has an emotion as brought on by an Stimulus or Topic.  'The joyful reunion took place on Sunday.'  'The Polish-born Pope was driven past jubilant crowds.'  'I am glad about the sheep .'

arguments.definition: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.  'At Medicine Man's ragtime dance contest, a jubilant girl drove the crowd wild.'
The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible Stimulus.  'Earl is jubilant about his new swim trunks.'
The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer.  'Putins initiative caused joyful excitement in Baku on Friday.'
The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion.
The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.  'He met me with a glad face.'
The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response.

The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response.  In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus.  Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances
The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer.  'Armed officials marred the joyful mood at the recent Mon festival in Samut Sakhon.'.
The Event is the occasion or happening that Experiencers in a certain emotional state participate in.  'I am helping them to have the joyful birth they want.'
The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus.

Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).  Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State can be described as having said emotion.

Emotions_success_or_failure.definition: A Topic or Stimulus fails or succeeds at causing an emotion in an Experiencer, which is conveyed by an Expressor or manifested in a State or description of an Event.  'They were dissatisfied with the arrangements.'

arguments.definition: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible Stimulus.
The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer.
The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion.
The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response.
The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response.

The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response.  In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus.  Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances
The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer.
The Event is the occasion or happening that Experiencers in a certain emotional state participate in.
The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus.

Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).  Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State can be described as having said emotion.
The number of times the Experiencer feels the emotion.

Mental_stimulus_exp_focus.definition: An Experiencer has an emotion as caused by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.   'I fall asleep hours later to the sound of their engrossed murmuring.'  'Most of these great lords are downright infatuated with Italy.'

arguments.definition: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible Stimulus.
The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer.
The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion.
The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response.
The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response.

The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response.  In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus.  Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances
The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer.
The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus.

Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).  Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer is has a feeling about the Stimulus.
The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The Duration is the amount of time for which the Experiencer is affected by the Stimulus, Topic, or State.</def-root >

Emotions_of_mental_activity.definition: An Experiencer can be described as having an emotion as induced by a Stimulus.  'The children enjoyed noise games and sing-songs.'  'The pleasures of eating are fleeting.'   'Diners delight in counter culture cuisine.'

arguments.definition: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer.
The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion.
The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response.
The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response.

The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response.  In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus.  Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances
The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus.

Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).  Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer has an emotion as caused by the Stimulus.
This FE sums up what is expressed in the main clause, often with a VPing.

Mental_stimulus_stimulus_focus.definition: A Stimulus serves to bring about an emotion of mental stimulation in an Experiencer.  'You will not easily find a more absorbing box-set of piano discs.'  'New classes of free radical are particularly interesting to chemists.'

Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer  can be described as having said emotion.
How often the Stimulus Stimulus affects the Experiencer.

Others_situation_as_stimulus.definition: An Experiencer feels an emotion as evoked as an Other.  'One might pity the frail old man in East Berlin.'  'She appealed for compassion for sufferers.'  'I feel for women who also long to have children but can't.'

arguments.definition: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The Other is the person that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer.
The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion.
The Explanation is the explanation for why the Other evokes a certain emotional response.
The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Other evokes its response.
The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the feelings of the Other.

Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the feelings of the Other which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).  Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer feels for the Other.
The  Situation is the circumstances or topic about which the Experiencer feels an emotion.
How often the Other gets sympathy from the Experiencer.

Annoyance.definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, or State has a feeling of annoyance as evoked by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.  'Peck was annoyed at the interruption.'  'Maggie noted his rather irritated expression.'

arguments.definition: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible Stimulus.

The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having said emotion.

Just_found_out.definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having a surprised emotion as evoked by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.  'I was more shocked about the child than she was.'  'Mrs Nowak was surprised by the amount of money Mills left her.'  'I think the shock of that recognition drove me a little crazy.'

The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having said emotion.
Type describes the kind of response the Stimulus or Topic invoke in the Experiencer.
Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the experience invoked by the Stimulus.

Emotions_by_possibility.definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State can be described as characterized by a particular emotion as evoked by a possibility in their future (Stimulus) or concerning a given Topic.

The Event is the occasion or happening that Experiencers in a certain emotional state participate in.

Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).  Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State can be described as having said emotion.

Fear.definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as characterized as having an emotion of fear concerning a particular Topic or as evoked by a Stimulus.  'I was scared by a bump in the night.'

arguments.definition: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible Stimulus.
The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer.

The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer.
The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus.

Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).  Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience.
The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having said emotion.

Confronting_problem.definition: An Agent becomes involved in an Issue which has negative consequences for them. The Agent will normally respond to resolve the Issue.  'I confronted both issues.'

arguments.definition: This FE identifies the Issue that the Agent deals with.
The Agent is the person who is acting to deal with the Issue.
This FE identifies the Place where the intentional act occurs.
This FE identifies the reason why the Agent confronts the issue.
This FE identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This FE identifies the way in which an Agent goes about facing the Issue.

Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
The Domain within which the Agent acts.
The Frequency with which the Agent does the Act in a given period of time.
The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
The Result describes the resulting outcome of the confronting act.
Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.

Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases.
This FE gives a description of the confronting event as a whole.

Dying.definition: A Protagonist is near or approaching death.  'But a dying patient is still a living patient.'

arguments.definition: The FE  Protagonist is the being or entity that dies.
The location where the dying event happens.
The Explanation why the dying event occurs.
When the dying event occurs.
How long the Protagonist is dying.

Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
How often the dying event occurs.

Prevent_or_allow_possession.definition: An Agent or Potential_hindrance keeps a Protagonist from having a State_of_affairs that they need or desire, or, despite the possibility of preventing the possession, they allow the Protagonist to have the State_of_affairs.  'His parents deprived him of food for days on end.'  'Our lonely city starves us of original live music.'  'Employees were denied overtime pay and meal breaks. CNI '  'Allow me just one more cupcake ! CNI'

arguments.definition: The Potential_hindrance is the force which keeps the Event from happening, or does not prevent it.  'Israeli law effectively deprived the owners of their homes and lands.'
The  is the situation, state-of-affairs, or state of having a possession that the Protagonist is kept from having.  'Their parents denied them a brand new car upon their sweet 16.'
The Time is when the Potential_hindrance keeps the Event from taking place.
The Place is where the Potential_hindrance keeps the Event from taking place.
The Agent is the  person who keeps the Event from happening.  'The uncaring King Frank often starves his citizens of tax relief.'
The Protagonist is the person who is kept from having the State_of_affairs.
The reason why the Agent keeps the Protagonist from having the State_of_affairs.  'I have suggested depriving children of TV-viewing time as a sanction.'
The length of time for which the Protagonist is denied the State_of_affairs.
How it is possible that the deprivation event occurs.  'By acting as his own agent, Joe deprived himself of this valuable information.'
This FE marks the frequency with which the Protagonist is prevented from having the State_of_affairs.
An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time of prevention and which the prevention is taken to be a part of.

Relating_concepts.definition: A Concept_1 is related to Concept_2 by some Evidence.   'The single remaining piece of evidence linked Kirov the tailor to Kirov the dissident activist.'  'There is ample data relating earnings to years of schooling.'

arguments.definition: The concept which is linked to Concept_2.    'High death rates among smokers connect cigarettes with disease.'
The concept which is tied to Concept_1.    'Skid marks on the street connects my neighbor's car to my broken mailbox.'
The point of view from which the connection exists.  'As far as we are concerned this evidence ties the secretary to the case of the missing apple fritters.'
The phenomenon that points to or proves the connection between Concept_1 and Concept_2. Generally expressed as an external.  'Footprints connect her to the crime.'
The Circumstances under which the connection exists.  'If we get the protocal right the study will link leprosy to too much stress-inducing homework.'
The two concepts expressed jointly.  'Ample evidence is able to connect the two.'
The Degree of connection between the Concepts.  'This definitively connects our water shortage problems to the ascendance of a new governor.'
A further specification on the linkage.  'The evidence causally links these two.'

Level_of_force_resistance.definition: A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target. With certain LUs (e.g. impregnable.a), the Opposing_force FE is incorporated, and with many LUs, it is mostly null instantiated. This frame covers both individual-level/static uses ("the DURABILITY of jade") as well as stage-level/dynamic uses ("the shoulder is PLIABLE after stretching"), although the individual-level meaning is the more basic and is much more prominent in the data.   'The great and impregnable fortress still stands today.'  'His heart is by no means strong, so he should ease into his exercise regime. INI'	  'They were strapping athletic lads with fine belts and sturdy boots. INI'  'The staircase remained robust under decades of heavy use.'   Productive metaphors include cases where the social resistance of an entity to (an) opposing social force(s) is conceptualized as the physical resistance of an entity to an opposing physical force. More specifically, the resistance is an entitys propensity to resist change in social realms such as the economic, political, and cultural: 'California has had (until now) a robust property market. INI' 'The durability of the peace will soon be tested. INI'  Similarly, there are instances where the entitys resistance is psychological instead of social, where psychological subsumes emotional and other mental properties: 'The idea proved remarkably durable.' 'We should remember the fragility of the human psyche. INI' 'His sturdy resilience to knocks and setbacks was impressive. INI'  ''  Compare to: Level_of_force_exertion.

arguments.definition: The Resisting_entity is the item that resists the Opposing_force to the level specified by the target.   'These are made from a tough plastic foam and are very light to wear.'  'A great number of hardy plants usually succeed in blooming even in the severest season.'   'The fragile canoe did not capsize!'

The Degree to which the Resisting_entity resists.  'Their colonial structures turned out to be very durable.'  Where Degree is expressed by a comparative or superlative form of the target, the FE is marked on the target (as well as on the rest of the comparative/superlative expression, if present): 'On the whole, triticale is hardier than wheat.'
The location where the Resisting_entity resists an external force.  'They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest in the big old backyard oak.'
The Time when the Resisting_entity resists an external force.   'The retaining wall was even weaker yesterday, and had begun to crumble.'
The Circumstances under which the Resisting_entity resists an external force.   'Wexford thought the yellow chair felt flimsy as he lowered his heavy body into it.'
This FE describes the force resistance of the Resisting_entity.   'Scottish ancestors had given her an amazing toughness which enabled her to endure the hardships of life.'
The Domain is the field in which the Resisting_entity resists an external force.   'Factors that determine the choice of materials include physical robustness.'

The Opposing_force is the item placed in opposition to the Resisting_entity. Opposing_force hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the Resisting_entity to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core FE is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.   'The fortress was impregnable to attack by hostile invaders.'   'Its best-known feature is its soft and pliable duck-like beak. INI '

Launch_process.definition: An Agent acts to begin the life of a Process.  'After discovering her knack for organization, she decided to try to  launch a career in human resources.'  'The City of Bratislava has launched a pilot project of providing internet access in the city centre.'

arguments.definition: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the Agent initiates.
This FE identifies the Place where the Process is initiated.
The Means is the way in which the Agent initiates the Process.
This FE is for the Time when the Agent initiates the Process.
Medium is the physical or abstract setting in which the Agent initiates the Process.
The Agent is the actor responsible for starting the Process.
To what end the Agent initiates the Process.
This FE identifies the first Co-timed_event of the started Process.
The way in which the Agent initiates the Process.
This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
The reason why or the way in which the Agent initiates the Process.
The state of the world at the time when the Agent produces the Process.

Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
A consecutive event to the starting of the Process of the Agent.

This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.

This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
This FE identifies the  Depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.
This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness.
The party for who's benefit the Process is launched.

This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily
How often the Process is launched.

Passing.definition: An Agent physically transfers a Theme to a Recipient. The Agent is not under control of the Theme's motion after the initial input of energy.   Compare with Bringing and Sending. In the former, the Carrier is in constant control (even physical contact) with the Theme. In the latter, the Sender plans the motion of the Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along the specified path (or to the specified goal), but under the power of a separate individual.  'Pat passed me the ball.'

arguments.definition: The Agent is the one who passes the Theme.  The Agent is generally realized as the External Argument.  'Pat passed me the ball.'
The FE Theme is generally an NP Object that is passed to the Recipient.  'Pat passed the ball to the goalie.'
The FE Source is the starting point of the passing action  'Pat passed the ball from behind the defensemen.'
The FE Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor Goal.  'I passed him the ball over the wall.'
The FE Recipient is the entity which possesses the Theme as a result of the passing.  'Kim passed the salt to her mother.'
The FE Distance is any expression characterizing the extent of motion of the Theme.  'Pat passed the ball 50 meters to me.'

The FE Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which passing takes place when the passing is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. Locative setting adjuncts may also be assigned this frame element.  'The team passed the ball around the court.'
The state of a participant during the passing action. 'We passed the ball around, gleeful.'
The FE Means indicates the action that is taken that results in the motion of the Theme

The FE Manner is any expression which describes a property of the motion of the Theme which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, and other things count as Manner expressions.

An entity saliently involved in the transmission of force from an Agent to a Theme.  It may be the Agent's bodypart, or some kind of device.  'When playing basketball, you should pass with both hands.'
The Place is the general area that provides a setting for a specific motion (with Source, Path, or Goal).  'The players passed the ball to each other at the park.'
The time at which the passing of the Theme occurs.
A resultant state that the Theme is in at the end of its motion.   'The center passed the ball clear of the double-team.'
A previous state that the Theme was in before the beginning of its motion.  'Paul passed the ball away from the danger of the double-team.'
This FE denotes a proposition from which the main clause logically follows.

Win_prize.definition: A Competitor claims a Prize as a result of the outcome of their participation in a Competition.  Competition is meant to be construed broadly to include cases where there is no skill involved as well as cases where there is no ranking of participants, and indeed does not require that there be multiple pariticipants or a definable end of game, as in the case of winning prizes at a carnival game. All that is required to be this kind of Competition is that there is some way of determining whether a Competitor will receive the Prize.  'We won a car in the raffle.'  ''  The use of win.v in this frame is similar to the Finish_competition frame, but there are a number of differences. Firstly, Win_prize focuses on what the Competitor receives as a result of their participation in a process. Unlike Finish_competition, Win_prize does not necessarily give any information about how a Competitor ranked relative to other competitors, or even if there is any system of ranking of competitors, or any end of the process that is defined as winning or losing. Win_prize only requires a system for determining which Prize or prizes go to a Competitor, if any. That is why the opposite of "I won (something)" in Win_prize is not "I lost", but rather "I didn't win anything".

arguments.definition: The individual or individuals involved in the Competition.
A quantity whereby progress is measured during the game, and Rank and Prizes are awarded to the Competitor afterward.
The amount by which the Competitor 's and Scores differ.
The rank (according to Score) that a Competitor acheives.
A socially and/or monetarily significant entity which is given to a Competitor according to Score or Rank.
An action of the Competitor that results in the outcome of the Competition.

Any description of the Competitor which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a Competitor that also affect their action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
When the Competition takes place.
The location where the Competition takes place.
This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a Competition.
Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
The event in which the Competitor competes.
The reason why the Competitor wins the Competition.
The length of time from when winning events began to be repeated to when they stopped.
The individual that the Competitor has been competing against.
The state of the world when the Competitor wins the Competition.
The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily.
The state-of-affairs that prevails as a result of the Competitor winning the Competition.
The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times the Competitor wins the Competition.
This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the winning event operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness, or a description of the state-of-affairs introduced by the winning event.

Beat_opponent.definition: A Winner has victory over an Loser.  'He always beats me at chess.'

arguments.definition: The individual or individuals who beat the Loser.
A quantity whereby progress is measured during the game, and Rank and Prizes are awarded to the Winner afterward.
The amount by which the Winner 's and Loser 's Scores differ.
The rank (according to Score) that a Winner acheives.
A socially and/or monetarily significant entity which is given to a Winner according to Score or Rank.
An action of the Winner or Loser that makes the beating event possible.

Any description of the Winner or Loser which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a Winner or Loser that also affect their action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
When the Winner has victory over the Loser.
The location where the Winner has victory Loser.
This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a competition.
Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
The reason why the Winner has victory over the Loser.
The length of time from when winning events began to be repeated to when they stopped.
The individual or individuals that get beat by the Winner.
The state of the world when the Winner beats the Loser.
The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily.
The state-of-affairs that prevails as a result of the Winner beating the Loser.
The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times the Winner beats the Loser.
This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the winning event operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness, or a description of the state-of-affairs introduced by the winning event.
A qualitative measure of how much the Winner beat the Loser.
This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.
The event in which the  Competition competes.
How often the Winner beats the Loser.

Punctual_perception.definition: A Perceiver briefly perceives a Phenomenon, often resulting in partial or uncertain perception.  A Body_part that enables the perception may be mentioned, either metonymically replacing the Perceiver or in addition to the Perceiver.  'I 've been waiting here to catch a glimpse of the snow leopard for seven hours.' 'If you go in there, you 'll get an eyeful. INI'

arguments.definition: The being who has a perceptual experience, generally construed to be not on purpose.   'When she looked back, Maria glimpsed an arm clawing around the corner.'

The entity or phenomenon that the perceiver experiences with his or her senses. It is typically expressed as Object with verbs.  'The waiter glimpsed a fly disappearing under the surface of the soup.'
The Body_part is the location on the body where the perceptual experience  takes place.  It is typically expressed in a PP.  'Mata Hari turned to her lawyer as her eyes glimpsed the blindfold.'
The Location_of_protagonist during the perceptual experience. It is typically expressed in a from-PP.  'She had only glimpsed him briefly from behind a veil.'

This frame element is used for all path-like expressions, except those indicating the location of the perceiver (see above), that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception.  'Hard to be certain what I glimpsed through the crack of the door.'
The state of the Perceiver during the event of perception.
The perceptual background against which the Phenomenon is  experienced (or not experienced) by the Perceiver.   'Had he caught a glimpse of her face among the crowd?'
Any description of properties of perception, such as: clearly, loudly, etc.  'Pat secretly glimpsed the designs for a new headquarters.'
The Degree indicates the degree to which the Perception is experienced.  'A nightmare creature, barely glimpsed in the swirling dense smoke, was beating at the flames coming from its own body.'
The action whereby the Perceiver perceives.  'He just glimpsed the car by craning his neck.'
The Time, generally construed as punctual, at which the Perceiver or the Body_part perceives the Phenomenon.
The length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end.

Legal_rulings.definition: An Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal Case.   'The judge ruled yesterday that the revisions were not adequate. DNI'  'A high court in London ruled on the case that a vulture fund can extract more than $20 million from Zambia for a debt.'  'In the California case, a judge ruled Oct. 12 that Tendler must pay the bloggers' legal fees.'

arguments.definition: The Authority (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the Finding.  'The US International Trade Commission ruled that a 1987 anti-dumping tariff against frozen concentrated orange juice from Brazil could be revoked DNI.'
This FE identifies the outcome of the Authority's deliberation or consideration.  'Miss Mahmod's father ruled that she would never marry him.'
This FE describes the question on which the Authority gives a Finding.  'US Supreme Court ruled on flag salutes in public schools today.'
When the Authority gives his Finding.
Where the Finding takes place.
This FE indicates the basis in law of a Finding.
The Circumstances under which the ruling was reached.
This FE identifies the Manner in which the Authority acts.
This FE identifies the purpose why the Authority returns a particular Finding.
This FE identifies an action that the Authority performs in order to return the verdict.
The Explanation for the Finding.

This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily

Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the ruling event operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
The amount of time that a Finding holds.
The person about whom the Authority passes a judgment or Finding.  'They held judgment upon me as a convicted traitress.'

Mention.definition: A Communicator or Medium briefly references something in a Message, in which only a subpart of the full content is profiled.   'The General Secretary mentions some of them in his report.'  'The Queen 's Speech also mentions the importance of making sure that Iraq complies with United Nations resolutions.'  ' When Barack Obama's name was mentioned, boos filled the room. CNI'

arguments.definition: The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a Message to another person.   'Her father never mentioned it.'
The Addressee receives a Message from the Communicator.   'I mentioned it to him in direct terms.'

A proposition or set of propositions that the Communicator wants the Addressee to believe or take for granted.   'A CBS report did mention that the First Lady was required to wear a flak jacket for her safety.'
The physical or abstract setting in which the Message is conveyed.   'The report also mentioned contamination problems during the manufacture.'
The Depictive describes the state of the Communicator.
The Manner in which the Communicator communicates.  'Her mother mentioned casually that Parr had gone to Belfast.'
The Means by which the Communicator communicates.
When the the Message is mentioned.
Duration is the length of time during which the communication takes place.
The number of times the Message is mentioned by the Communicator.  'I mentioned it fourteen times and it still wasn't enough.'

Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
How often the Communicator mentions the Message.
The relevant entity or state-of-affairs that the Communicator mentions.  'If someone mentions things like ration books , my stomach turns.'

This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
The state of the world when the Communicator mentions the Message or Specified_content.
The location where the Communicator communicates the Message.
The purpose for which the Communicator mentions the Specified_content.

Indicating.definition: A Communicator or Medium assigns linguistic meaning to an Unresolved_referent thereby identifying the specific actor or entity which fulfills the answer to this question.   'Can you name all the U.S. Presidents?'  'No doctor can name the disease that's killing him.'  'Every year, InfoWorld names 100 companies that have made the best use of technology.'

arguments.definition: The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey the Unresolved_referent to another person.
The thing to which the Communicator or Medium refers for identification purposes.
The physical or abstract setting in which the Unresolved_referent is conveyed.
The amount of information exchanged when communication occurs.
The Depictive describes the state of the Communicator.
The Manner in which the Communicator makes the indication.
The Means by which the Communicator makes the indication.
When the the Communicator is makes the indication.  'When this is resolved, I will name the winner.'
Duration is the length of time during which the indicating takes place.
How often the Communicator or Medium indicates the Unresolved_referent.  'Every month, new people name him in connection with these crimes.'
The reason why the Communicator is indicating the Unresolved_referent.
The location where the Communicator or Medium indicates the Unresolved_referent.
To what end the Communicator or Medium makes the indication.

Cycle_of_existence_scenario.definition: An Entity comes into being, exists for some time, and ceases to be.

arguments.definition: Concrete or abstract entity that did not exist, then came into existence, then (potentially) ceased to exist.

Socially_significant_history_scenario.definition: A series of Events are important to humankind and its culture.

arguments.definition: This FE identifies the event which occurs to create history.
This FE identifies where the event takes place.
This FE identifies the time when the event occurs.
Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
The Domain is (a characterization of) the type of event that is part of the Event's history.

Ceasing_to_be.definition: An Entity ceases to exist.  'Entire platoons have mysteriously vanished from battle, leaving enemy weapons to slice through empty air.'

arguments.definition: Concrete or abstract entity that does not exist after the event.
This is the Place where the new Entity ceases to exist.
This FE identifes the Time when a new Entity ceases to be.
This FE labels the Explanation of the destruction or disappearance of the Entity.
This FE identifies the components into which the Entity dissipates.
This FE identifies the length of time before the Entity comes into existence again.
The aspect of the Entity which no longer exists.
This FE identifies the Period_of_iterations during which habitual or iterative actions are performed.
The way in which the Entity disappears.
The completeness of the disappearance of the Entity

Out_of_existence.definition: An Entity has ceased to exist.  'Theses termites are history.'  'Hillary is toast after Texas and Ohio.'  'They are gone because you killed them all.'

arguments.definition: Concrete or abstract entity that does not exist after the event.
This is the Place where the Entity (saliently) does not exist.
A point at which the Entity (saliently) does not exist.
This FE labels the Explanation of the destruction or disappearance of the Entity.
This FE identifies the length of time before the Entity comes into existence again.
The aspect of the Entity which no longer exists.
The way in which the Entity disappears.
Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

Cycle_of_life_and_death.definition: A Protagonist is born or sprouts, lives, dies, and then is dead.

arguments.definition: Protagonist identifies the being or entity that is dead or alive. 'Frank was dead.'

History_scenario.definition: This frame describes how Events are related to each other and Place and Time.

arguments.definition: This FE identifies the event which occurs to create history.
This FE identifies where the event takes place.
This FE identifies the time when the event occurs.

History.definition: A recordable sequence of events is associated with a given Topic.   'And that is where the history of art begins.'

arguments.definition: The Topic is the subject about which the history is given.  'The role of the Byzantine Empire in European history is not understood by all.'
The Domain is (a characterization of) the type of event that is to be included in consideration of the Topic's history.  'Elizabethan Stage remain classics of literary history.'
The end of the span of time during which the Topic occurs.
The beginning of the time span over which the Topic occurs.
The span of time over which the events related to the Topic take place.
The Duration, often expressed in calendric units, of the history of the Topic.
When the events concerning the Topic occured.

Possibility.definition: A Possible_event is deemed to have all pre-conditions satisfied; in other words, it has some probability of occurrence, if some (generally implicit) further Condition pertains.  The Condition, whether overt or implicit, often concerns the decision of an agent to attempt to bring the Possible_event about. The primary implication is that certain other aspects of the situation that might have been expected to prevent the Possible_event, usually lack of capability or permission, do not pertain.  'You ca n't burn glass . INI' 'You can have two more if you want .' 'This sense of lack can never be satisfied .' 'We just ca n't stand it anymore . INI'  This frame is confusable with the Capability frame, which specifically involves an Agent who is presented as needing only the decision to perform an Action in order to successfully perform the Action.

arguments.definition: The Possible_event has met its preconditions, and will occur if some further Condition holds.
The Circumstances under which the preconditions of the Possible_event are met.  'In this weather, an experienced pilot can still manage to fly 500 miles.'
An entity, event, or state that brings about the possibility of the Possible_event.
The state-of-affairs that does not hold, but if it did, the Possible_event would occur.  'If he wants , he can have all the fishsticks .'
The time at which the Possible_event can occur.  'You can come in now.'

Duration_relation.definition: A Period or Eventuality is related to its Duration.  Alternatively, an Entity may stand in metonymically for an Eventuality that it is involved in.  'You wouldn't last five minutes!'

arguments.definition: A situation, action or event whose duration is being described.  The Eventuality occurs as the External Argument if the adjective is used predicatively, or as the modified noun if the adjective is used attributively:   'The lecture did n't last long .'  'My unease persisted for some time .' 'Persisting decades past the end of the war , the economic disaster was to shape the fate of central Europe .'
Sometimes a period of time, rather than an event or state is described.    'This difficult period lasted only a short while .'
The amount of time that the Eventuality, Period, or Entity lasts.  'If the film lasts more than one hour , I ca n't stay .'

An item which is metonymically related to an Eventuality.  Some common eventualities that are metonymically entailed are the effect of the entity in its capacity as an instrument and the existence of the entity.  'The anesthesia lasted four hours .' 'You would n't last five minutes !'

An individual that deploys a resource to receive a benefit.  The construction that introduces this FE is idiosyncratic, combining with last (in this frame), cost, and take--and more marginally see (in "saw me through the winter") and keep (in "It 'll keep me for a while .")  In this frame, the resource maps onto the Entity, and the benefit is the Eventuality.  'A gallon of water wo n't last us more than a few days .'

Duration_scenario.definition: An Event or Period has a particular Duration.  The Duration may be characterized in several different ways: as a Durational direct measure, a Degree of deviation from an expected Duration, or as a Count of Units of standard, known duration.

arguments.definition: The Period whose the duration Attribute is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of an Period which is under discussion, namely the duration.
A quantity or other characterization of the Period's absolute duration.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the Duration from the norm.
A standard measure, having a known duration.
The number of Units which are equivalent to the Duration of the Period .
An process whose duration is measured.

Delimited_state_scenario.definition: A State (often an ongoing process) is ongoing for some period of time.

arguments.definition: A quantity or other characterization of the State's absolute duration.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.

Tolerating.definition: The words in this frame describe an Experiencer's feelings of tolerating with respect to some Content. A Reason for the toleration may also be expressed.  Although the Content may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion.    ' He could not tolerate the smell of coconut . '

arguments.definition: The Experiencer experiences tolerance with respect to the Content.

Content is what the Experiencer's feeling of tolerance is directed towards..  The Content differs from a stimulus because the Content is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion.  ' Everyone must endure some disappointments in life.'
The Explanation is the explanation for why an Experiencer tolerates the Content.  ' Spouses often tolerate their partner's vices because they love the overall person.'
The Degree to which the toleration occurs.
Manner of performing an action
The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer tolerates the Content.  'Intellectual tolerance is a very important trait to have in this field.'
The Topic is the area about which the Experiencer has the  tolerated experience(s). ' They 're very tolerant about boys' mess in the home and untidiness generally.'
The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer.  'Tracy was in a surprisngly tolerant mood today.'
The Event is the occasion or happening that Experiencers in a certain emotional state participate in.

The Circumstances FE encodes the circumstances or conditions under which the Experiencer experiences the emotion. Unlike Content it does not give the specific content of the emotion, but the Content can often be inferred from the Circumstances.
The time at which the Experiencer is in the state of toleration.  'When they are young,, they  cannot stand extremes of temperature. '

Attempt_means.definition: An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal using some Means.    'John tried using a crowbar to open the door.' 'They tried opening the window in order to rob the store.'  Very frequently, an entity involved in a Means action stands in for the Means, and similarly a Goal may be metonymically expressed with an entity related to a Goal situation:  'John tried a crowbar on the door.' 'They tried the window in order to rob the store.'  Unlike the Attempt frame, the Means is focused upon, and the Goal is often implicit.  This frame answers the question of how something is to be attempted, rather than what is being attempted.  The frames can be most reliably distinguished by paraphrasing a sentence with "give X a try", since "give try" belongs only in this frame.

arguments.definition: The Agent makes an attempt to achieve a Goal. 'Dana tried a crowbar.'
The Goal is what the Agent attempts to achieve.  'John tried using a crowbar to enter the locked door.'

Note: this FE might not be in frame.  It is temporarily here during the early stage of annotation. (JGK)   The Outcome is the failure or success of an attempt to achieve a Goal. 'He tried the back door but it was firmly bolted.'
This FE identifies the Means by which an attempt occurs.  'Dana tried using a crowbar.'
This FE identifies the Degree to which an attempt occurs.
This FE identifies the Time when the attempt occurs.
The Depictive is a phrase which describes the Agent.
The place where an attempt is made.  'On the bridge he tried the crowbar.'
The Manner in which the Agent makes the attempt.  'He quietly tried the crowbar.'
The time peiod over which the attempts take place.
The reason for which the Agent attempts the Goal.

Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is independent of the the attempt of the Agent to achieve the Goal.
Note: this FE might not be in frame.  It is temporarily here during the early stage of annotation. (JGK)  The area of work to which the Attempt event belongs.
This FE denotes the number of times an event is attempted per some unit of time.

Pattern.definition: This frame describes the interrelation of a collection of Entities; they may be physical entities or shapes in a recognizable configuration, a pattern of events, or a relation among abstract entities.  The pattern is not the individual Entities nor the set of Entities, but an abstraction of their interrelations, as a gestalt.  'The Cougers are playing in a Wing-T formation tonight.' 'The auditors noticed a suspicious pattern of withdrawals from the maintenance account .' 'The digits of irrational numbers do not repeat in any kind of pattern'

arguments.definition: The entities whose interrelations form the pattern.
The name of the pattern, such as "wing-T".
A descriptor of the pattern, such as "regular".

Sequence.definition: The words in this frame describe entities that occur in some temporally-ordered sequence.  The entities thus have some sort of relation between them that might be described by the Relative_time frame.  However, at this time, this frame has no Frame Relation with that frame (though this is still under discussion).  Additionally, it should be noted that the words in this frame have a metaphorical link to the words in Shape.  'Describe in detail the sequence of steps taken during an emergency.'

arguments.definition: This entity occurs in some sequence with Entity_2.
This entity occurs in some sequence with respect to Entity_1.
Entities that occur in some temporal order.
A characterization of the sequence in which the entities occur.  'The study consisted of a chronologically varied SERIES of grotesque heads.'
This FE identifies a characteristic or description of the sequence.

Manipulate_into_shape.definition: An Agent manipulates a Theme so that it ends up in a particular shape or configuration denoted by a Resultant_configuration.  'She molded the playdough into a ball.'

arguments.definition: The Agent is the volitional actor who manipulates the Theme.
The Instrument with which the Theme is manipulated.
Where the manipulation of the Theme takes place.
The Purpose for which the manipulation of the Theme takes place.
When the manipulation of the Theme takes place.
The Means by which the manipulation of the Theme takes place.
The Explanation for which the manipulation of the Theme takes place.
The object which is manipulated by the Agent into a particular shape.
The Manner in which the manipulation of the Theme takes place.  'John coiled the wire tightly around the spool.'
Where the manipulation of the Theme takes place.  'Kelly wound the laces around the back of her heel to combat loose shoes.'
The shape or configuration of the Theme after being manipulated by the Agent.  'He twisted the wire into a hook.'

Go_into_shape.definition: A Theme, which may or may not have a default shape or configuration, goes into a particular shape without being made to do so by an agent. Depending on the type of shape, there may be a Locus about which the Theme changes shape.  'It curled up into a cylinder after laying in the sun.'

arguments.definition: Where the shape-changing event takes place.
The Explanation for which the change into the shape occurs.
When the changing into a particular shape occurs.
How long the event takes place.

Any description of the shape-changing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
How often the shape changing occurs.
The Theme goes into a particular shape.
The Result is the shape the Theme becomes.  'It folded into a ball.'

This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
The conditions under which the Theme is shaped.  'The leaf folded in the sun because the heat evaporated much of its water content.'
The state of the Theme with respect to the change brought about by making the adjustment.  'The contraption folds to fit in the bag.'

Capacity.definition: An Entity has the ability to contain a Theme.  'Our facility seats up to 500 people.'

arguments.definition: The Entity whose ability to contain items is assessed.   'Our facility seats up to 500 people.'
The extent to which the Entity exceeds or falls short of the minimum requirements for holding the items.
The Circumstances under which the Entity meets or fails to meet the pre-conditions for containing.
An entity, event, or state that causes the Entity to be able or unable to hold the items.
The status of the capability (e.g., innately, with modifications).
The Entity has the ability to contain the Theme, often expressed with a quantity.  'Our facility seats up to 500 people.'
A description of one of the participants, typically the Theme but possibly the Entity.  'Our facilities seat 500 people seated.'</def-root >
This FE denotes a sub-part of the Entity which has a particular capacity. 'The two small cars seated only 32 inside.'
The Purpose of the Entity's specified capacity. 'It seats approximately 180 persons for full silver service.'
The Time at which the Entity has or had a certain capacity.

Event_instance.definition: This frame describes a particular instance of an event.  'These next two days will be the last two times that I'm here.'

arguments.definition: The particular Instance of a given event. All LUs in this frame incorporate this Frame Element.  'He dumped trash for the last time.'  'He tapped me twice on the shoulder.'
The event that occurred in one or more instances.  'Listen to this song six times.'
A property of the particular Instance.  'This is the first time I've grown such delicious tea.'
The specific number of iterations.  'The last 3 times I did this, I lost the game.'  'This one time, at band camp, we went to the lake.'

Location_in_time.definition: The word(s) in this frame detail a particular moment in time.These often occur with demonstratives such as this and that.  'Late that day, 1776, America declared sovereignty.'

arguments.definition: Relative_time denotes words that locate the time with respect to an identifiable reference point. '' 'The last day of June, market crashed.'
Name denotes the name of the particular point in time. '' 'Make sure you lock the doors at closing time.'

The Whole describes the larger unit of which the target word describes one part. If there is an appositive that is necessarily larger, it's the Whole. '' 'What time of day is it?'  ' On that day, 1449, a battle raged.'

The particular, salient point in time. If a specified time is present, it is the focal time. Otherwise, the unit is the focal time. If there is an appositive that specifies an entity that it not necessarily larger than the target, both the unit and the specification are the FE. '' 'I didn't see it at that time.'  'The time is 10:00.'  'That day, Dec. 7th, will live in infamy.'
Salient_event is an event that is associated with the given point in time. '' 'It is time to go.'
A Descriptor is any characterization or description of the point in time that is not covered by a more specific FE. '' ' WWII was a strange time to be an American.'

Timespan.definition: The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.  'The best time of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.'

arguments.definition: A quantity or other characterization of the State's duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.  'He was a great actor in his time.'
The Whole is the larger moment in time of which the target is a part.  'What time of year do you suggest we visit Tbilisi?'
Any characterization or evaluation of the timespan not covered by a more specific FE.

Concessive.definition: A speaker marks a Conceded_state_of_affairs as being or implying a contradiction to the Main_assertion.  Some LUs specify the Main_assertion, others the Conceded_state_of_affairs, as referring to the preceding discourse (i.e. DNI), while yet others are conjunctions joining the two.  'Although she had some trouble , she was able to finish about two hours early .' 'Nevertheless , we did win . DNI ' 'I wanted to come , but I did n't remember where the party was . '

arguments.definition: A proposition or set of propositions that the speaker wants the addressee to believe or take for granted. This statement is not asserted, but presupposed by the speaker of the sentence, and is mentioned to contrast with the Main_assertion. It would or could seem to predict a situation different than the Main_assertion, but, for reasons left implicit, this normal prediction is contradicted by the fact that the Main_assertion and the Conceded_state_of_affairs are both simultaneously true.
An entity which metonymically stands in for an associated Statement.  'She got married in spite of him .' 'Despite her , they finished on time .'

The statement that the speaker wishes to assert or offer as their main contribution to the discourse, which is be modified or hedged in some way by the Conceded_state_of_affairs. The force of the contribution of the Main_assertion is presented as undiluted by the fact that something different from the Main_assertion would normally by predicted, based on the facts in the Conceded_state_of_affairs.

Cause_to_perceive.definition: An Agent, Actor, Entity, or Medium causes a Phenomenon to be perceived by a Perceiver.  With an Actor, Entity, or Medium, the Perceiver is usually unspecified.   'Aileen showed Rob the book.' 'He exhibited great interest in the project.' 'The second scene depicts  Dad  holding the ball for a place kick.' 'The economy is showing signs of growth.'  NB: This may change in the future, but as of now this frame subsumes three closely-related cause/perceiver alternations:  a.) perception of a specific Perceiver caused by an Agent, b.) perception of some implicit audience caused, possibly unintentionally, by an Actor, and c.) perception of some implicit audience caused by a Medium or Entity. Perhaps this frame is too broad - the different subject FEs seem to all indicate different ways of "showing."

arguments.definition: The Agent intentionally creates a situation in which the Perceiver observes or experiences the Phenomenon.
The Phenomenon is an entity or idea that is perceived by the Perceiver.
The Perceiver is made to have a perceptual experience by the Agent.
The instrument or method by which the Perceiver was shown the Phenomenon.
A description of the way in which the Agent presents the Phenomenon.
When the event occurs.
Frequency describes how often the Agent presents the Phenomenon.
The location where the Agent causes the perception of the Perceiver.
The purpose of the Agent in creating the perception of the Perceiver.
An Actor is a sentient being who is exhibiting, possibly uninintentionally, some Phenomenon.
An object that has some association with a Phenomenon.
The Medium through which a Phenomenon is expressed.
A Co-participant is an entity that participates in a coordinated way in the same event as the Actor or Co-participant Agent.
The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.

Representing.definition: An Entity represents some Phenomenon through its existence and/or defining characteristics.  Sometimes a Cognizer, a people or group of people who believe in the representation, is expressed. 'A bear symbolizes strength in some cultures.'

arguments.definition: The event, idea, or emotion evoked by the Entity.
This FE describes the Degree to which the Entity represents the Phenomenon.  'That mural is hardly a symbol of what we're all about!'
The time period in which the representing occurs.
This FE describes the means through which the representing occurs. 'What does a black and white snake symbolize in a dream?'
An object that has some association with a Phenomenon.
The Cognizer is the person or group of people who believe in the representation.
The Frequency denotes how often the Entity is associated with the Phenomenon.
The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the represenation logically follows.
The Place where the representing event occurs.

Labor_product.definition: An Agent or a Cause mentally or physically expends energy rendering an Input, whether implicit or explicit, into a Output.  'Erosion is the work of wind and water on rock.'  NB:  The Input in the case of artistic Output, or an " artistic work" as more commonly referred to, is usually INI, because the material at hand being rendered is usually an idea or artistic material that is taken as common foreground knowledge by the semantics of the Agent's professional role.  'One of Chinua Achebe's greatest works was Things Fall Apart. INI'

arguments.definition: A sentient entity whose physical and mental faculties are directly expended on the Input to create the Output.
A non-sentient entity whose physical faculties are directly expended on the Input to create the Output.
The mental or physical faculties onto which the Agent or Cause expends energy.
The end product, either a concept or physical object onto which the Agent or Cause has exerted its mental or physical faculties from the rudimentary state of Input.
A word or phrase that characterizes the target.
